item.title: Rensselaer at Work Co-Term Information Session - February 26
item.description: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - RPI students considering the NEW online, part-time Co-Term are invited to join us for pizza and this information session in the Student Union to learn about the Institute’s available programs. Expect to hear details about the project-based model, learning through iteration, and how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise in a targeted and experiential learning environment. Let us know to we can expect you by registering.

item.title: GD&T Skills Course Registration Deadline - February 26
item.description: The Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) course is designed as an overview of the topics relating to the application and understanding of GD&T. 12 hours of instruction total. A certificate of completion will be awarded for this class. Students must attend all sessions for certificate. Sessions will be from 5 – 8:00 pm on March 13, 17, 20 & 24 in Troy 2018. Course is Free for RPI students. Class is limited to 20. To sign up email skomsm@rpi.edu.

item.title: Civil and Env. Eng. to host - Troy Water Crisis Panel Discussion
item.description: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 12:30 PM - 2:00 PM - Concerned community members and environmental advocates come together for a panel discussion on the current lead pipe crisis in Troy, NY. Panelist are: Greg Campbell-Cohen of TIMBER; Jona Favreau, Troy Resident; and Rob Hayes, Senior Director of Clean Water at EANY. Reception to begin at 12:30-CBIS Hernstadt Gallery, co-sponsored by STS. Discussions start at 1pm in the CBIS Auditorium.

item.title: STS Colloquium with Veronica Aguila to be held on February 26
item.description: STS invites you to join Veronica Aguila’s colloquium on February 26 from 11:30am-1pm in Sage 5711. Unlike software designers, Internet of Things designers must negotiate global supply chains to realize their visions. By bringing a case study from open hardware design in Mexico, Dr. Aguila shows how technology trade policies—and trade policy in general—have shaped and will continue to shape computing designs and design practices (hardware, firmware, and software).

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: “Listening in a Hectic World”
item.description: Tuesday, March 4, 2025 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Listening is a vehicle to get the information needed to accomplish work objectives. In today’s information-saturated work environment, everyone needs to be able to tune out the “noise” and tune in to what’s important. In this seminar, we explore a listening approach that balances the demands of getting the information that you need with the awareness that every interaction provides an opportunity to cement solid work relationships with others.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: In Person Workshop: Deeper Dive into the Active Learning Approaches of Jigsaw, Think/Pair/Share, and Visual Maps
item.description: Tuesday, March 4, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - In this workshop, we will focus on the three active learning concepts of the Jigsaw activity, Think/Pair/Share and working with Visual Maps/Charts. We will spend some time on each of these three approaches, discussing the concept of each and looking at examples to help you think about how you might be able to incorporate the approach into your class as an activity. Please register

item.title: ChatGPT/AI Tools Informal Community Space Created
item.description:
An informal community Webex space has been created to collaborate on AI tool use in the classroom, and is available to share, collaborate, and brainstorm on this topic in an informal asynchronous setting. Interested faculty, staff, or graduate TAs who would like to be added to this community cohort space are asked to please email Maureen Fodera.
